thread.title: Fiat Chrysler chief skips Frankfurt for US union talks
thread.title_full: Fiat Chrysler chief skips Frankfurt for US union talks

title: Fiat Chrysler chief skips Frankfurt for US union talks
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Sep 14, 2015, 19:55 BST - UK Markets closed Fiat Chrysler chief skips Frankfurt for US union talks AFP â€“ 55 minutes ago View Photo 

Fiat Chrysler chief Sergio Marchionne cancelled plans to speak at the Frankfurt auto show as labor talks in the United States head down to the wire, the automaker said Monday. 
Marchionne was set to attend the launch of a new Alfa Romero on Tuesday morning but cancelled those plans Monday "due to other commitments in the United States," Fiat Chrysler said in a statement. 
The contract between the automaker's US arm, FCA US, and the United Auto Workers union is set to expire at midnight on Monday (0400 GMT Tuesday). The union leadership has authorization to call a strike if a deal is not reached. 
"At this time there is no decision on extensions of the September 14 deadline," the UAW said in a statement Sunday. 
The powerful union is currently renegotiating its contracts with all three big US automakers, FCA US, General Motors (NYSE: GM - news ) and Ford. On Sunday the UAW tapped FCA as the 'lead bargaining company'. 
That means that the deal reached with FCA will be used to shape the contracts at Ford and GM. 
The union has historically ensured that its employees do not face competitive disadvantages by negotiating identical wages and benefits at the Detroit Three carmakers. 
The lead or target company has more influence over shaping the contract, although minor details like work rules at specific plants are negotiated separately with each company. 
"All three companies are working hard toward a collective bargaining agreement," UAW president Dennis Williams said Sunday. 
Fiat Chrysler declined to comment on the status of the negotiations (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
